review_text: BEST PLACE EVER ! We stumbled upon the Tri-Peaks area last year and fell in love with it .So much ,that we decided to spend our 25th anniversary here. Larry's cabin was perfect choice for our get away .Beautifully situated on lake with stunning views where we peacefully watched varieties of water fowl ( including white pelicans ),boats and even eagles fly by.The cabin itself was so cozy and fully stocked with more than you could imagine .Cabin is centrally located to so many attractions. I don't know of anywhere else you can be fishing 1 minute and 15 minutes later be sitting atop a mountain ( Mt. Nebo ).Larry is the nicest person ,suggested restaurants and checked in on us periodically to see if we needed anything ( which we didn't since he literally thought of everything!)He is genuinely about making your stay the best .We stayed for 5 nights and wish we could stay longer .We will definitely be back !

This place is a perfect example why I love Airbnb. It was quite literally, a home away from home with everything we didnâ€™t know we needed.
We made a group trip for my husbands 30th birthday party, only 6 of us ended up coming but this house was absolutely perfect for the relaxing weekend we were looking for. We came for a golfing trip, but got so much more. The house had everything we needed, from cooling off after our day on the course to being able to cook breakfast and grill when we wanted. All the beds were comfortable, great showers, air, TV, grill and fire pit. And the cornhole and yard darts were just a plus. I was really worried about not bringing any â€œotherâ€ things to do while in the house, this made our nights so much more fun! Highly recommend for a relaxing weekend get away.

,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: We were a little worried about traffic, but the front and back yards are huge and provide a real sense of privacy. The location is convenient to Russelville restaurants, the Ozark National Forest, and the Hot Springs and Ouachita National forest areas. We drove to all and came back at night to this great house. Arriving, we were greeted by two rocking chairs on the front porch. Inside, the house was immaculate, tastefully decorated, and completely updated. Very quiet inside. Edward and Bonnie provided every amenity, including fresh fruit and snacks and every kitchen utensil or appliance you might need. The coffeepot accommodates both drip and pods, so perfect! Plenty of plates, bowls, cups, and flatware. New appliances, including laundry. Pods were provided. Plenty of towels and washcloths. Our kids enjoyed the firepit outside. It was too cold to use the grill and patio, but those would be great in warmer weather. If you're looking for a home base to explore Arkansas, this is it!

One thing that also stood out was when I first arrived and was having tire issues, Larry told me the right place to go to get it taken care of, and even checked my tire pressure! We felt provided for! The experience we had at this cabin exceeded our expectations.

Go to Mt Nebo!!

This is so well thought out from the design and furnishings to the fact it had almost anything you could think of stocked in case you forgot something. They have bicycles to fishing poles. The view is breathtaking. We ate our meals on the deck and had our morning coffee there as well. Larry is an amazing host. Quick response time, we arrived lamps was on, ac was on and tv was on. It honestly felt like we were home. We only planned a cpl day stay this time. Planning on trying to get a week in come spring. We enjoyed relaxing outside and slept great on the king sized bed!

review_text: I didn't believe the reviews I read because I've had some pretty negative Airbnb experiences even with good reviews. But, Larry's place is totally everything and more! The view for one was absolutely stunning with being right on the water. It was quiet and with lots of seating options outside. The two AC units inside were amazing at keeping it cool. He had a fully stocked kitchen with everything we could possibly need. There were extra pillows and blankets too. Cable TV in case you didn't want to watch the water outside. A hammock to relax by the water. Even fishing poles! Ms. Kitty was also very sweet. Larry was really respectful of our space. I started a conversation with him and was delighted to hear more of why he hosts people at this cute place. Overall, I would go back in the fall especially and try out the bikes, fishing, hiking around, local diner, etc.

name: Tara
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
March 2021
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
So many good things to mention about Garyâ€™s place. The first thing that comes to mind is COMFORT. Everything was so comfortable - the beds, the blankets, the couch, the chairs, everything. The shower was amazing - great water pressure and plenty of hot water even after three hikers washed away the dayâ€™s adventure. The kitchen was well-stocked (and we made every meal here) and there was even laundry soap, dishwashing detergent, full sized bottles of body wash, shampoo and conditioner. It felt more like we were staying at a friendâ€™s house than a rental.
The second thing I have to mention is LOCATION. Weâ€™re from Houston where itâ€™s flat flat flat and we wanted to do some hiking that was strenuous but within a days drive. Garyâ€™s place was perfect. We went up AR-7 to Twin Falls for an amazing 6 mile hike. We went a little west to Mt. Nebo for a wonderful day of hiking loads of trails. And we went to Petit Jean State Park and hiked all over the place. It was always such a nice drive home in the evening. We never felt it was too far of a drive to anywhere we wanted to go. And the traffic was non-existent. The grocery store 1.5 miles away is FULL of amazing organic food, too!
Gary was also very responsive and his place exceeded our expectations by far. I cannot stress it enough - if you need a place to stay while youâ€™re anyway near Russellville, stay here. You wonâ€™t be disappointed. We hope to be back in the summer to hike some more.

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This is a clean, comfortable and attractively furnished house that we're glad we booked. It's easy to get to and well outfitted with amenities to enhance a traveler's stay. Every conceivable kitchen utensil is available, but those who like to cook should note that the kitchen is not stocked with any cooking oil or spices. The house can comfortably sleep up to 4 people, two to a bed, but the small bistro style table and chairs in the kitchen only seat two. There is another table for two on the small front porch. The Wi-Fi is unpredictable but Verizon cell coverage is strong. Bottled water and complimentary snacks are a welcoming touch. The host is gracious and responsive. Parking, accessible in front of the house, is slightly angled in a way that is peculiar but manageable. All in all, this Airbnb is a good choice for a couple who needs some space. Also, we recommend the Salvadorian restaurant nearby. Yum!

review_text: This was a clean and tidy studio that had peaceful surroundings and all the amenities you could want. It's near the lake and grocery stores. The bathroom is technically in the kitchen so if there's more than one of you, be aware of the close quarters. This is a studio, so no separate rooms. The bed was large and comfortable. The A/C was cool and there's a big fan if you want more. There's also a ceiling fan over the bed and a vent in the bathroom/kitchen. Lots of lighting! That was a blessing! The fridge is huge with an ice maker! Make sure it is actually ON however. Someone had turned it off and the host didn't notice. We turned it on and it was noisy in the night because it's right by the bed, so we figured out why someone had turned it off. My daughter appreciated the full body mirror. There were so many innovative details that we were really impressed with. This place is sharp! The trees and mossy back/side yard were glorious!

Our hosts were immediately responsive to our request for help with the broken tv remote, which they replaced right away, also brought us more k-cups and clean towels at the same time.
So quiet and private but convenient to Russellville, and only a couple miles from Interstate 40. We fully enjoyed our stay at the tiny house.

review_text: Came late PM. Snacks in the kitchen, drinks in the refrigerator, pizza in the freezer. Driveway made for bringing boats with easy drive through. Was able to park the boat under the awning and plug-ins on either side to easily recharge the boat batteries. Reading room/office very peaceful with fast internet. Didn't use but had a great bunk room that could sleep up to seven. Other two bedrooms with queen beds. Bed comfortable. Bathrooms well equipped. The house is in close proximity to Lake Dardanelle and within 15 miles of Lake Atkins. Both excellent fishing lakes and the reason for our visit. Sat in the gazebo which also had a fan for these hot summer nights. We were very pleased with this stay and highly recommend the Brown Stone Cottage. Would recommend for families or groups needing a large property close to outdoor activities and restaurants.

I would highly recommend this Airbnb to anyone that needs a short stay or an extensive one!

review_text: This is a lovely place to getaway with a significant other or a small family. It was in amazing shape, and the owner thought of everything. I was surprised to find things that any traveler could forget. Shampoo and even a hairdryer. It was quiet, and had just enough room for me and my significant other. Everything works well, and I didn't have any bad experiences. The bed was very comfortable. My favorite thing about this place is the chalk board on the wall. It has all you need to know and I loved that the owner really cares about the guests. The price is amazing for what you get! I would choose this over a hotel anytime! I can't wait to stay here again! Number one place on my list for sure!
